ygData.subject: Re: [EverQuest] Hello and a Money making question
ygData.msgSnippet: Honestly, for the most part, money does not really start to get easier until you hit the low to mid 20 s, as at that point, depending upon where you hunt, mobs
ygData.messageBody:
Honestly, for the most part, money does not really start to get easier until you hit the low to mid 20's, as at that point, depending upon where you hunt, mobs start to drop fine steel and bronze weapons, not to mention chainmail and bronze armor.  There are certain areas, and mobs you can camp at most levels, from about 6 on, that drops a bit better gear than others.  The only other way to gain much in the way of pp at the lower levels is to drop every cp earned into a tradeskill such as smithing, or tailoring, to get it up to over 100, where you can sell stuff to other players, such as player made backpacks, and banded armor.  All it takes to find the right mobs is experimentation, and research, eventually you will find what you are looking for.
 
Rich
----- Original Message -----
From: Nuada Armat'gh
To: EverQuest@yahoogroups.com
Sent: Tuesday, June 18, 2002 11:14 AM
Subject: Re: [EverQuest] Hello and a Money making question

I to thought that there were quick fix ways of getting money, but all it comes down to is killing the right mobs, i.e farming giants etc, selling your wares from tradeskills and farming items such as centi weapons etc. a lot of ppl tend to use a high lvl char to fund thier twinks, which is most likely the reason for the excessive amounts of money players buy/sell things for - sometimes it feels like im trading in russian rouble's as in pp being near worthless :(

i have seen some of these guides but havn't bought one yet so i have no idea as to there real value or content.Most likely they are like other official Game Guides for other games i.e a waste of time and money, anything in the guides you can probably find out just by asking the right questions or checking out sites such as alakazam and casters realm, i would ask around see if anyone has bought one before paying for information.

Nuada - KIA

Druzil Ro
